resources.string: The drip method is by far the simplest. You need to grind the coffee into a fine powder. You need to boil the water, but as with all forms of coffee you should make sure that the water is at 195 F (91 C). You will need to take the kettle off the heat for roughly 25 seconds to get this temperature. Use the timer below to cool the water.

Making coffee with a french press can easily be the most satisfying ways to make coffee. You must make sure to use a coarse grind. The pieces should still be sizeable. The water you use to steep the coffee will need to be approximately 195 F (91 C). After grinding the coffee place it into the french press so it will be ready to steep. To get the water to the right temperature you will need to hold the kettle off of the heat for roughly 25 seconds. Use the timer provided below to time this out.

Now that the water is cool enough to not burn your grind you will need to let the grind steep for approximately 6 minutes. Lucky for you we also provided that timer below. Note: make sure to fold the grind into the water every so often for better flavor!
Now you need to put the press on and slowly press down over the course of 30 seconds or so. You guessed it: we provided you with a timer for your success.
